mental_health_blogs.name: NAMI Blog
mental_health_blogs.description: A treasure trove of information on all things related to mental health, providing an exhaustive blog and list of resources for almost everything you may need to better understand mental health [1][3].

mental_health_blogs.name: Anxiety And Depression Association Of America
mental_health_blogs.description: Filled with invaluable advice and insights, evidence-based coping mechanisms and real-time blog responses to world events, this outlet can help bring peace to our mind on an as-needed basis [1].
mental_health_blogs.altText: Anxiety And Depression Association Of America

mental_health_blogs.name: The Mighty
mental_health_blogs.description: A seemingly never-ending resource that provides support to people living with mental health disorders. Content covers more than 6,000 topics and is mostly authored by people who themselves are affected by mental health conditions [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: The OCD Stories
mental_health_blogs.description: Publishes real stories to educate and inspire those living with OCD. More than a blog, it also offers a podcast, which has been downloaded over 2 million times, for people with OCD, families affected by OCD, and therapists treating those with OCD [2][3].

mental_health_blogs.name: Clear Recovery Center
mental_health_blogs.description: Specializes in dual diagnosis mental health and substance abuse treatment. The blog is written by the same people that write their blog and often features interviews with therapists, psychiatrists, and other mental health professionals [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Depression Warrior
mental_health_blogs.description: Hosted by mental health peer, Laura Beker, who has lived with major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, and borderline personality disorder. Her posts share stories and cite research to help those suffering from mental illnesses [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: The Anxiety Guy
mental_health_blogs.description: Dennis Simsek, pours his passion and commitment to helping people understand the causes of anxiety and effectively cope with related mental health conditions into his blog [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: OCDtalk
mental_health_blogs.description: A powerful blog and resource designed by a mother whose son was completely debilitated by severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. OCDtalk advocates for OCD awareness through incredible story-telling and includes information about upcoming events, media features, and her book, Overcoming OCD: A Journey to Recovery [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Lighting Up the Sky
mental_health_blogs.description: Provides both suicide awareness and prevention resources. Blog content includes personal experiences with suicide, mental illness, and healing [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Postpartum Progress
mental_health_blogs.description: A much-needed resource for those facing postpartum depression, postpartum anxiety, postpartum psychosis, depression during pregnancy, and more [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Healthy place – Anxiety Shmanxiety
mental_health_blogs.description: Addresses the effects of anxiety, panic, flashbacks, worries, and phobias. Each post offers hope, validation, and coping mechanisms to help manage anxiety and related disorders [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: OCD Writer by Carol Edwards
mental_health_blogs.description: Provides articles and educational documents centered around OCD and anxiety. Her posts are compassionate, insightful, and well-curated for a comprehensive guide to OCD [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Clear Recovery Center’s Teen Program
mental_health_blogs.description: Has a designated website and blog for its Teen Program. Topics covered in this blog include teenage mental health issues as well as teenage substance abuse issues [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Storied Mind
mental_health_blogs.description: Blogs are written by John Folk-Williams. His main motive in creating this blog is to share the ideas, stories, and information that have helped him get free of depression and restart his life [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Anxious Lass
mental_health_blogs.description: A personal mental health and lifestyle blog written about the real-life experiences of anxiety by blogger, Kelly Jean [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: You Have OCD
mental_health_blogs.description: A recovery program that specifically focuses and obsessive-compulsive disorder. The blog provides a tremendous amount of information about this mental health condition [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Headspace Depression Blog
mental_health_blogs.description: Provides a place that highlights blogs related to almost any topic you could think of. They also provide information on meditation and general mental wellness [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Your Mental Health Pal
mental_health_blogs.description: Breaks down the harmful stigma surrounding mental health concerns by raising awareness and contributing to educational efforts [3].

mental_health_blogs.name: The OCD Diaries
mental_health_blogs.description: Originally concerned with defeating depression and addiction, but it has since expanded to cover Everyman’s struggle to survive the darkest moments of life and enjoy more time in the light [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Healthy Place
mental_health_blogs.description: The largest consumer mental health site, providing trusted information on mental health disorders and psychiatric medications from both a consumer and expert point of view [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: The Guardian Depression Blog
mental_health_blogs.description: The latest news and features on depression from the world’s leading liberal voice [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: The Conversation Anxiety
mental_health_blogs.description: Browse anxiety-specific news, research, and analysis that allows for open communication regarding mental health issues [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: MyPTSD
mental_health_blogs.description: A Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder / Complex Post Traumatic Stress Disorder community that is comprised of blogs, articles, and a support forum for sufferers and supporters [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: The Mental Elf
mental_health_blogs.description: Ensures to keep you up to date with reliable mental health research, policy, and guidance [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Creatives Against Depression
mental_health_blogs.description: Created + run by creatives for creatives. The blog was started to serve as a place where people who are struggling with mental health issues realize they’re not alone [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Blurt
mental_health_blogs.description: Strives to increase awareness and understanding of depression through Twitter chats, story writing, collaborations with communities, and the Blurt Peer Project [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: A Place of Hope for Depression Blog
mental_health_blogs.description: Has been providing comprehensive, professional, and expert, whole-person care for addiction, depression, trauma, and other life challenges since 1984 [2].
mental_health_blogs.altText: A Place of Hope for Depression Blog

mental_health_blogs.name: Anxiety Boss
mental_health_blogs.description: The Anxiety Boss blog by psychiatrist, Dr. Carlo Carandang, MD, shares nearly everything readers could possibly need to know about effectively treating anxiety through multiple techniques [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Jenni Shaefer – Trauma and PTSD
mental_health_blogs.description: Works to provide an accessible space and safe space to share content from the incredibly knowledgeable perspective of an eating disorder advocate, author, speaker and coach [2].

mental_health_blogs.name: Depression and Mental Illness Resource Blog
mental_health_blogs.description: Aims to help people with depression, anxiety, and other mental health challenges succeed in their basic, everyday tasks and move towards the life they want to live [2].
mental_health_blogs.altText: Depression and Mental Illness Resource Blog
